problem_text:
Suppose G is a finitely generated group such that, for any set π of primes and any subgroup H of G, if G/HGπ is a finite π-group then |G : H| is a finite π-number. Is G nilpotent? This is true for finitely generated soluble groups.
J. C. Lennox
answer: Not always (V. N. Obraztsov, J. Austral. Math. Soc. (A), 61, no. 2 (1996), 267–288).
